trans-unit.source: Contains all of the configuration settings needed by the WS-Federation Authentication Module (<xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationAuthenticationModule"></xref>).

An instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration> class that is set on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.FederationConfiguration> object accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthentication.FederationConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property contains the settings that are used to initialize the properties of the WS-Federation Authentication Module (WSFAM) and control its behavior.
These settings are typically loaded from the `<wsFederation>` element in the configuration file.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration"></xref> class from the specified `<wsFederation>` element.
The properties of the new instance are initialized according to the settings of the specified `<wsFederation>` element.
Some validation is performed on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement> object specified by `federationElement`.

Both the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement.Issuer%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement.Realm%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property must specify non-null, non-empty values.

If the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement.RequireHttps%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set `true`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement.Issuer%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property must specify a URI that has an HTTPS scheme.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WSFederationElement.Freshness%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property cannot be negative.
If any of these conditions are not met, an exception is thrown.
The `<wsFederation>` element from which to initialize the new instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration"></xref> class by using the specified issuer and realm.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.Issuer%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.Realm%2A> properties are initialized according to the `issuer` and `realm` parameters.
All other properties are initialized to their default values.
A string that contains the URI of the issuer to be used by the WS-Federation Authentication Module (WSFAM).
A string that contains the URI of the requesting realm to be used by the WSFAM.
issuer is `null`.
-or-
realm is `null`.
Gets or sets the value of the wauth parameter to use in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
A URI that specifies the authentication type.
The default is an empty string.
Gets a dictionary that contains any extra attributes specified in the `<wsFederation>` element in the configuration file.
The dictionary that contains the extra attributes.
A constant that contains the default value for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.Freshness"></xref> property; zero.

A constant that sets the default <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxArrayLength"></xref> property of the XML dictionary reader quotas object referenced by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas"></xref> property.

A constant that sets the default <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxStringContentLength"></xref> property of the XML dictionary reader quotas object referenced by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas"></xref> property.

A constant that contains the default value for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.PassiveRedirectEnabled"></xref> property; `true`, passive redirects are enabled.

A constant that contains the default value for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.PersistentCookiesOnPassiveRedirects"></xref> property; `false`, cookies are not enabled.

A constant that contains the default value for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.RequireHttps"></xref> property; `true`, HTTPS is required on redirects.
Gets or sets the value of the wfresh parameter to use in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
The desired maximum age of authentication requests, in minutes.
The default is <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.DefaultFreshness"></xref>.
Gets or sets the value of the whr parameter to use in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
The address of the home realm identity provider.
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets a URI that identifies the intended issuer of the security token.
The URI that identifies the security token service (STS).
Cannot be `null`.
An attempt to set the property to `null` occurs.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the module is enabled to initiate WS-Federation protocol redirects.
`true` to enable redirects; otherwise, `false`.
The default is <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.DefaultPassiveRedirectEnabled"></xref>, redirects are enabled.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a persistent session cookie is issued on successful authentication.
`true` to issue a persistent session cookie; otherwise, `false`.
The default is <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.DefaultPersistentCookiesOnPassiveRedirects"></xref>, cookies are not enabled.
Gets or sets the value of the wp parameter to be used in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
A URL that identifies the policy to use.
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets the value of the wtrealm parameter to be used for WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
A URI that identifies the relying party (RP) to the security token service (STS).
Cannot be `null`.
An attempt to set the property to `null` occurs.
Gets or sets the value of the wreply parameter to use in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
A URL that identifies the address at which the relying party (RP) application would like to receive replies from the Security Token Service (STS).
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets the value of the wreq parameter to use in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
The token issuance request expressed as a `<wst:RequestSecurityToken>` element.
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets the value of the wreqptr parameter to use in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
A URL that specifies the location of the token issuance request expressed as a `<wst:RequestSecurityToken>` element
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether communication with the security token service (STS) must use HTTPS protocol.
`true` if communication with the STS must be secured using HTTPS; otherwise, `false`.
The default is <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.DefaultRequireHttps"></xref>, HTTPS is required.
Get or sets the value of the wres parameter to use in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
The wtrealm parameter, which is set by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.Realm%2A> property, should be used instead of this parameter.
A URI that identifies the resource being accessed, the relying party (RP), to the to the security token service (STS).
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets a query string that contains any additional parameters to be sent in WS-Federation sign-in requests ("wsignin1.0").
A URL fragment that contains the additional message parameters in the following format: "?param1=value1¶m2=value2¶mN=valueN".
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets a query string that contains any additional parameters to be sent in WS-Federation sign-out requests ("wsignout1.0") during passive sign-out.
A URL fragment that contains the additional message parameters in the following format: "?param1=value1¶m2=value2¶mN=valueN".
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets the value of the wreply parameter to use during WS-Federation sign-out requests ("wsignout1.0").
The URL to which the client should be redirected by the security token service (STS) during passive sign-out through the WS-Federation protocol.
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets the configurable quota values for XML dictionary readers used by this instance.
The object that contains the configurable quota values.

The default object has the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxArrayLength"></xref> property set to <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.DefaultMaxArrayLength"></xref> and the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReaderQuotas.MaxStringContentLength"></xref> property set to <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.Configuration.WsFederationConfiguration.DefaultMaxStringContentLength"></xref>.
An attempt to set the property to `null` occurs.
